123 // Check if the given memory address is accessible by the SP
124 static inline bool IsValidMemoryAddress(const void* address, size_t size)
125 {
126  // TODO: Need better checking here
127  return (address != NULL && size < 0x80000000);
128 }
129 
130 // We expect all HSP accessible addresses to begin with 0x2F0xxxxx
131 #define VALID_HSP_MEMORY_ADDRESS_BASE 0x2F000000
132 #define VALID_HSP_MEMORY_ADDRESS_MASK 0xFFF00000
133 // Maximum address range size an HSP crypto block can handle (Arbitrarily set to 64K since this is just used for sanity checking)
134 #define MAX_HSP_ADDRESS_RANGE_SIZE 0x10000
135 
136 // Check if the given memory address is accessible by the HSP
137 static inline bool IsValidHspMemoryAddress(const void* address, size_t size)
138 {
139  return (((uint32_t)address & VALID_HSP_MEMORY_ADDRESS_MASK) == VALID_HSP_MEMORY_ADDRESS_BASE && size < MAX_HSP_ADDRESS_RANGE_SIZE);
140 }
141 
142 #endif //__MEMUTILS_H
